alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 13 at 4:13PM EDT until March 17 at 6:40AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... East Fork White River, near Rivervale, at Williams, and near Bedford. White River at Elliston, Edwardsport, Hazleton, and Petersburg. Wabash River at Terre Haute, Mount Carmel, Vincennes, Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site and Montezuma. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers due to rainfall last weekend. Minor flooding is occurring, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The crest of the East Fork White River is slightly past Shoals. The crest of the White River is nearing Petersburg. The crest of the Wabash River is slightly past Vincennes. Flooding will gradually end this week, with the last of the flooding forecast to end Saturday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, High water surrounds elevated river cabins. County roads to these cabins are impassable. Agricultural flooding is in progress. Seep water develops behind levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Saturday /9:00 PM EST Saturday/ the stage was 18.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CST Saturday /9:00 PM EST Saturday/ was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 9.1 feet Wednesday, March 23. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
